translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sakka’s Rebuke
The Elder Sakka’s Rebuke
“When the Fortunate One Vipassī
had the supreme Bodhi tree of pāṭali,
having seen that foot-print,
I delighted in that place.
Having taken a broom,🔽I swept the Bodhi tree right there;
having swept that Bodhi tree,
I worshipped the pāṭali.
Having delighted in that place,

analyzed: sire katvāna añjali  namassamānaḥ tam bodhi
translated: having placed my hands together above my head;🔽having worshipped that Bodhi tree,
I went to my own hut.

analyzed: tādi maggena gacchāmi  sarantaḥ bodhim uttama  ajagaraḥ mam pīḍesi
translated: As I was going along that path,🔽worshipping the supreme Bodhi tree;
a very powerful, fearful-looking python🔽oppressed me.
The deed I did near (the Bodhi tree),
the result satisfied me;
it devoured my body,
I delighted in the world of the gods.
My mind was free from defilements,
always pure and bright;
I do not know the dart of grief,
the burning of my mind.
Leprosy, tumours, and itch,
smallpox, and ringworm;
I have no scabies, or eczema,
is the fruit of my cleansing.
Sorrow and lamentation,
do not exist in my heart;
My mind is straight and upright,
is the fruit of my cleansing.
I do not get stuck in the meditative absorptions,
my mind becomes clear;
Whatever meditative absorption I wish for,
it succeeds for me.
I am not greedy for what is delightful,
or for what is hateful;
I am not deluded about what is deluding,
is the fruit of my cleansing.
For ninety-one eons,
the deeds I did then;
I do not know of any bad destination,
is the fruit of my cleansing.
My defilements are burned up,
all my existences are destroyed;
Like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations;
The six direct knowledges have been realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sakiṁsammajjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sakisammajjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Elder Sākiyamoggallāna recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Sākiyamoggallāna is finished.
